pygraphc.preprocess.CreateGraph module¶

class CreateGraph(events_unique, cosine_threshold)[source]¶

Bases: object

A class for generating graph from preprocessed logs.

_CreateGraph__create_edges()¶

Create all edges in the graph based on cosine similarity measure.

_CreateGraph__create_nodes()¶

Create nodes in the graph from unique events.

do_create()[source]¶

Main method to be executed to create a graph.

get_nodes_id()[source]¶

Get node identifier.

Returns:nodes – List of node identifier in incremental integer.
Return type:list[int]

class PreprocessLog(logfile=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

A class to preprocess event log before generating the graph model.

_PreprocessLog__read_log()¶

Read a log file.

do_preprocess()[source]¶

Main method to execute preprocess log.

static get_doclength(tfidf)[source]¶

Calculate doc’s length for cosine similarity

Parameters:tfidf (list[tuple]) – List of tf-idf value of each word in tuple.
Returns:length – Document’s length.
Return type:float
get_tfidf(doc, total_docs, docs)[source]¶

Calculate tf-idf (term frequency-inverse document frequency).

Parameters:
  • doc (str) – A single event log line.
  • total_docs (float) – Total number of logs or total line numbers.
  • docs (list[str]) – All logs in a file.
Returns:

  • doc (str) – Preprocessed event logs.
  • tfidf (list[tuple]) – List of tuple where a tuple consists of two elements: 1) word and 2) its tf-idf value.
